titles.title: National Security Council Membership Act of 2021
National Security Council Membership Act of 2021
To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to require the National Security Council's membership to include the Secretary of Homeland Security.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, and Intelligence (Permanent Select), for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary:
National Security Council Membership Act of 2021
This bill adds the Secretary of Homeland Security as a member of the National Security Council, which advises the President on national and international security matters.
